alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 11:38AM CDT until May 06 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. .Heavy rainfall received overnight will cause river levels to rise above flood stage. For the Jacks Fork River Basin...including Alley Spring...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. At 11.0 feet, much of Alley Spring Campground floods. Water flows through Alley Spring Campground and isolates the 200 Area Camp Sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Fri 1pm 1am 1pm Jacks Fork River Basin Alley Spring 9.0 3.9 Thu 10am 6.2 10.5 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
